720977f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 40th Street
720977f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., east sidc, south from and including East 42nd to and
including 40th Streets. Also shown is East 42nd Street, at and adjoining
the S.E. corner of Lexington Ave.
July 24, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712617f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - Lexington Avenue
712617f-a.text:
40th Street, Lexington, to Park Avenue. (Before Reconstruction).
Tresident Sorough of Manhatton.
CREDIT LEE IPE(ATIVE.  March 19, 1918.

720965f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 40th Street (East)
720965f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, at the S. E. corner of East 40th
Street, showing the lately erected Concord Pershing Apart-
ment House. This was included in the Gould Estate Auction.
January 24, 1927
Joseph P. Day
Photograph Dept.
87 Liberty Street.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

712615f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
712615f-a.text:
International Auto School and Garage, 145-147 East 40th Street,
north side, between Lexington and Third Avenues. In the
background the Chrysler Building is shown under construction.
July 25,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720969f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 40th Street
720969f-a.text:
369 Lexington Ave., east side, between East 41st and 40th Streets.
The 26-story building shown is the Lexington Towers. The view is south east
from the Bowery Savings Bank Building (110-116 East 42nd Street).
March 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720964f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 40th Street (East)
720964f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, south of E. 405h Street (foreground ) as
viewed from the Chanin Bldg. Note the street car tracks upon
same and the bus which replaced this earlier form of transporta-
tLon. To the left top aprears a partial view of Third Avenue,
south from 37th Street.
October 3, 1936.
P.L. Sperr
NO RRPRODUCTIONS.
